p: Third Judicial District of Washington Terry}Ss
To the Marshal of this Dist of Washington Terry:

Wherein on behalf of the United States has been made complaint in oath to me the undersigned a Commissioner appointed by the Supreme Court of the Territory of Washington for the Third Judicial Dist of said Territory to take acknowledgment of bail and affidavits and also to take deposition of Witnesses on said case, charging the did on or about the 20" day of Feby AD 1888 at Port Townsend Jefferson County and Territory of Washington did unlawfully enter the Territory of the United States, she being then and there a citizen of the Empire of China and prohibited from entering the Territory of the United States by Act of Congrees known as the Chinese Restraint Act, and being against the peace and dignity of the United States and contrary to the Statute in such case made and provided.

Now therefore you are hereby commanded in the name of the United States of America to apprehend the said N Gon Oi and bring her body forthwith before me or before some other proper officer authorized by law to arrest imprison and bail for for some such offence against the United States, wherover found in your District that she may then and there be dealt with according to law for said offense and have you then and there this writ
Given under my hand and seal this 20" day of February A.D. 1888
